page.title: 06STURRY
page.content: Sturry is a dormitory village 3 miles N.W. of Canterbury. Its accomadation consists of a mixture of houses over 100 years old and some recently developed estates. The old part of Sturry is divided from the new part by the level crossing. The automatic gates cause long delays and is a rather off-putting impression for continental visitors travelling along the A28 from the ports i.e.Folkestone and Ramsgate. Roads and pavements are generally in need of drastic repair,and villagers would like to see more improvments. There has been a considerable amount of agitation over the proposed plans of a by-pass.Most people are in favour of the idea but there are arguments as to where it should be put. Shop owners are worried about the drop in trade.
